definition: curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)

sentences.english: Imagine, these lowdown Southern segregationists put the Northern Democrats down.
sentences.chinese: 設想，南方隔離主義的內幕束縛北方民主黨。

sentences.english: But it is still unclear what information was actually peddled.
sentences.chinese: 但是到底兜售什麼信息纔算內幕交易還仍不明瞭。

sentences.english: Give me the lowdown what's the secret to get a job around here?
sentences.chinese: 告訴我一些內幕，要怎麼才能得到這裏的工作？

sentences.english: Also available to subscribers is IGN insider premium content, ad-free.
sentences.chinese: 也可供用戶是布圖設計內幕優質內容，無廣告。

sentences.english: Does Lei Jun let authority after all have why inside?
sentences.chinese: 雷軍讓權到底有何內幕？

sentences.english: What individual investors access to the so-called insider information?
sentences.chinese: 散戶憑什麼獲得所謂的內幕信息？

sentences.english: Chapter 3 focuses on China's regulation of cross-border insider trading.
sentences.chinese: 第三章中國對跨境內幕交易的法律監管。

sentences.english: Price-sensitive information is defined as information that is prohibited from being used in insider dealing.
sentences.chinese: 股價敏感信息定義爲禁止用於內幕交易的信息。

sentences.english: Like Helen I was once blind and deaf to the truths of the Republican Party.
sentences.chinese: 像海倫聾啞一樣，我曾經對共和黨的內幕毫不知曉。

sentences.english: In the end, we discuss the implications of the economic analysis on legislation and regulation on insider tradings.
sentences.chinese: 在此基礎上，提出了中國內幕交易立法和監管的思路。

sentences.english: There's a lot of behind-the-scenes work reported on the diplomatic cables.
sentences.chinese: 外交電報中，敘述許多幕後折衝內幕。

sentences.english: Mr. Pickwick, who had been deeply investigating the interior of the pigeon-pie, readily assented.
sentences.chinese: 深深地鑽研着鴿子餅內幕的匹克威克先生欣然首肯了。

sentences.english: Which insiders are selling and buying chunks of stocks?
sentences.chinese: 內幕人士買進賣出的大宗股票是哪些？

sentences.english: The division also provides counsel to the Insider Dealing Tribunal.
sentences.chinese: 此外，該科也爲內幕交易審裁處提供律師。

sentences.english: She was very anxious to get the lowdown in her new job.
sentences.chinese: 她急於知道新工作的內幕細節。

sentences.english: A:How can they always manage to get inside stories?
sentences.chinese: 他們怎麼總能搞到內幕消息？

definition: unspoken rules (usually ones that codify improper behaviors such as leveraging guanxi to get favorable treatment, or coercing employees for sexual favors)
to offer for sale/to sell/to sell out or betray
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
to leave (the stage, an exam room, the playing field etc)/to take part in some activity/to take an examination (in the imperial examination system)
"sensational headline writers", people who write misleading titles in order to generate clicks from Internet users/clickbait
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to repeat a lesson/to learn by heart/to endorse a check
startled/to frighten/scared out of one's skin
person who writes articles - newspapers, magazines, blogs (informal)/scribe/copyist/a talented writer of articles or of calligraphy
